CssProperty.name: voice-volume
CssProperty.description: Refers to the amplitude of the waveform output by the speech synthesizer. The value of 'silent' is mapped to '0' and 'x-loud' is mapped to '100'. The mapping of other values to numerical volume levels is implementation dependent and may vary from one speech synthesizer to the next.
CssProperty.syntax: <decibel> | silent | x-soft | soft | medium | loud | x-loud

CssProperty.name: voice-balance
CssProperty.description: Refers to the balance between left and right channels, and presumes a two channel (stereo) model that is widely supported on consumer audio equipment.

entry.description: Moves the sound to the left, relative to the inherited voice balance. More precisely, subtract 20 from the inherited value and clip the resulting value to the range '-100' and '100'.
Moves the sound to the right, relative to the inherited voice balance. More precisely, add 20 to the inherited value and clip the resulting value to the range '-100' and '100'.

CssProperty.name: speak
CssProperty.description: Specifies whether text will be rendered aurally and if so, in what manner.

entry.description: Suppresses aural rendering so that the element requires no time to render.
Uses language-dependent pronunciation rules for rendering an element and its children. Punctuation is not spoken, but instead is rendered naturally as various pauses.

Spells the text one letter at a time (useful for acronyms and abbreviations). In languages where accented characters are rare, it is permitted to drop accents in favor of alternative unaccented spellings.
Speak numbers one digit at a time, for instance, 'twelve' would be spoken as 'one two', and '31' as 'three one'.
Similar to 'normal' value, but punctuation such as semicolons, braces, and so on are to be spoken literally.
Similar to 'normal' value but punctuation is not to be spoken nor rendered as various pauses.

CssProperty.name: pause-before
CssProperty.description: Specifies a pause or prosodic boundary to be observed before an element or, if any 'cue-before' is specified, before these. Values indicate the prosodic strength of the break in speech output.

CssProperty.name: pause-after
CssProperty.description: Specifies a pause or prosodic boundary to be observed after an element or, if any 'cue-after' is specified, after these. Values indicate the prosodic strength of the break in speech output.

CssProperty.name: pause
CssProperty.description: Shorthand for setting 'pause-before' and 'pause-after'. If two values are given, the first value is 'pause-before' and the second is 'pause-after'. If only one value is given, it applies to both properties.

CssProperty.name: rest-before
CssProperty.description: Specifies a rest or prosodic boundary to be observed before an element's content.

CssProperty.name: rest-after
CssProperty.description: Specifies a rest or prosodic boundary to be observed after an element's content.

CssProperty.name: rest
CssProperty.description: Shorthand for setting 'rest-before' and 'rest-after'. If two values are given, the first value is 'rest-before' and the second is 'rest-after'. If only one value is given, it applies to both properties.

CssProperty.name: cue-before
CssProperty.description: Auditory icons are another way to distinguish semantic elements. Sounds may be played before and/or after the element to delimit it.

CssProperty.name: cue
CssProperty.description: Shorthand for setting 'cue-before' and 'cue-after'. If two values are given the first value is 'cue-before' and the second is 'cue-after'. If only one value is given, it applies to both properties.

CssProperty.name: voice-family
CssProperty.description: Comma-separated, prioritized list of voice family names (compare with 'font-family').

CssProperty.name: voice-rate
CssProperty.description: Controls the speaking rate. The default rate for a voice depends on the language and dialect and on the personality of the voice.

entry.description: Equivalent to 100% and means the normal rate for this voice.

CssProperty.name: voice-pitch
CssProperty.description: Specifies the average pitch (a frequency) of the speaking voice. The average pitch of a voice depends on the voice family. For example, the average pitch for a standard male voice is around 120Hz, but for a female voice, it's around 210Hz.

entry.description: Equivalent to 100% and means the normal pitch for this voice

CssProperty.name: voice-range
CssProperty.description: Specifies variation in average pitch. Human languages are spoken with varying inflection and pitch; these variations convey additional meaning and emphasis.

CssProperty.name: voice-stress
CssProperty.description: Indicates the strength of emphasis to be applied. Emphasis is indicated using a combination of pitch change, timing changes, loudness and other acoustic differences) that varies from one language to the next.

entry.description: Inhibits the synthesizer from emphasizing words it would normally emphasize.
Effectively the opposite of emphasizing a word. For example, when the phrase 'going to' is reduced it may be spoken as 'gonna'.

CssProperty.name: voice-duration
CssProperty.description: Allows authors to specify how long it should take to render the selected element's content. This property overrides the 'voice-rate' property.

CssProperty.name: speak-as
CssProperty.description: Determines in what manner text gets rendered aurally, based upon a basic predefined list of possible values.

entry.description: Uses language-dependent pronunciation rules for rendering the element's content.
Spells the text one letter at a time (useful for acronyms and abbreviations).
Speak numbers one digit at a time, for instance, 'twelve' would be spoken as 'one two', and '31' as 'three one'.
Punctuation such as semicolons, braces, and so on is named aloud (i.e. spoken literally) rather than rendered naturally as appropriate pauses.
Punctuation is not rendered: neither spoken nor rendered as pauses.

CssProperty.name: volume
CssProperty.description: Volume refers to the median volume of the waveform. In other words, a highly inflected voice at a volume of 50 might peak well above that.
CssProperty.syntax: <number> | <percentage> | silent | x-soft | soft | medium | loud | x-loud

entry.description: No sound at all. The value '0' does not mean the same as 'silent'.

CssProperty.name: play-during
CssProperty.description: A sound to be played while an element's content is rendered.

entry.description: Sound inherited from the parent element's 'play-during' property continues to play and the sound designated by the <uri> is mixed with it
Sound will repeat if it is too short to fill the entire duration of the element. Otherwise, the sound plays once and then stops.
The sound of the parent element continues to play.
Silence. The sound of the parent element (if any) is silent during the current element and continues after the current element.

CssProperty.name: azimuth
CssProperty.syntax: <angle> | [[ left-side | far-left | left | center-left | center | center-right | right | far-right | right-side ] || behind ] | leftwards | rightwards
CssProperty.description: Sound spatial information

entry.description: Moves the sound to the left, relative to the current angle. More precisely, subtracts 20 degrees.
Moves the sound to the right, relative to the current angle. More precisely, adds 20 degrees.

CssProperty.name: elevation
CssProperty.description: Sound spatial information

entry.description: Adds 10 degrees to the current elevation.
Subtracts 10 degrees from the current elevation.

CssProperty.name: richness
CssProperty.syntax: A value between '0' and '100'. The higher the value, the more the voice will carry. A lower value will produce a soft, mellifluous voice.
CssProperty.description: Specifies the richness, or brightness, of the speaking voice. A rich voice will 'carry' in a large room, a smooth voice will not.

CssProperty.name: stress
CssProperty.syntax: A value, between '0' and '100'. The meaning of values depends on the language being spoken. For example, a level of '50' for a standard, English-speaking male voice (average pitch = 122Hz), speaking with normal intonation and emphasis would have a different meaning than '50' for an Italian voice.
CssProperty.description: Specifies the height of 'local peaks' in the intonation contour of a voice. For example, English is a stressed language, and different parts of a sentence are assigned primary, secondary, or tertiary stress.

CssProperty.name: pitch
CssProperty.description: Specifies the average pitch (a frequency) of the speaking voice. The average pitch of a voice depends on the voice family. For example, the average pitch for a standard male voice is around 120Hz, but for a female voice, it's around 210Hz.

entry.description: Equivalent to 100% and means the normal pitch for this voice

CssProperty.name: pitch-range
CssProperty.description: Specifies variation in average pitch. The perceived pitch of a human voice is determined by the fundamental frequency and typically has a value of 120Hz for a male voice and 210Hz for a female voice.

CssProperty.name: speech-rate
CssProperty.description: Controls the speaking rate. The default rate for a voice depends on the language and dialect and on the personality of the voice.
CssProperty.syntax: <number> | x-slow | slow | medium | fast | x-fast | faster | slower

entry.description: Adds 40 words per minute to the current speech rate.
Subtracts 40 words per minute from the current speech rate.
